column4: hi, I'm having trouble getting a Realtek 2560 pci chipset in a Packard Bell EasyNote R1984 laptop. The card is detected and ubuntu loads both rt2500pci and rt2x00pci.. But I can't connect to any networks. I can't scan for networks either. It just says "disconnected" in the network-indicator
http://pastebin.com/mXBnyHNE I only took the relevant dev.
that only lists my usb device that I'm using to get online now.. aka wlan1.. nothing about wlan0
ifup wlan0 says "unknown device, ignoring wlan0=wlan0"
but it's missing from "lsmod | grep rt25", even when the usb device is unplugged?
can't check that now as I'll be disconnected :o
you may have to do that to find out why it is't seen...
hm, check this: http://pastebin.com/jJesiL4t My USB stick uses the rt73, so it doesn't appear with grep rt25..
seems liek it has some IRQ issues.. How do I do what it tells me to try? :)
you could try adding "pci=biosirq" to your grub boot line
okay, thanks! I'll write it down and take a look at it tomorrow. Gotta run ;) ktnxbye!
